intro: Microlicia trianae, commonly known as the Trianas' microlicia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its woody stem and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
